description: The Material Item segment (ITM) contains information about inventory supply items (stocked or non-stocked).

fields.name: Item Identifier
fields.description: The Item Identifier is a unique code assigned to the material item by the Item Inventory Master catalog software application to identify the item.

fields.name: Entity Identifier
fields.description: The first component, <entity identifier>, is usually defined to be unique within the series of identifiers created by the <assigning authority>, defined by a hierarchic designator, represented by components 2 through 4. See Section 2.A.33, "HD - hierarchic designator".

fields.name: Namespace Id
fields.description: The assigning authority is a unique identifier of the system (or organization or agency or department) that creates the data. Refer to User-defined Table 0363 - Assigning authority for suggested values.

fields.name: Item Description
fields.description: The Item Description is a description of the material item identified in ITM-1.

fields.name: Item Status
fields.description: The status (useful for reporting and item usage purposes) that applies to an item. Refer to User-defined Table 0776 - Item Status for suggested values.

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: The first component contains the sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the CWE.2. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: The second component contains the descriptive or textual name of the identifier, e.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression.

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: The third component contains the code for the name of the coding system from which the value in CWE.1 is obtained. Each coding system is assigned a unique identifier.

fields.name: Alternate Identifier
fields.description: An alternate sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. Analogous to "Identifier" in component 1. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Alternate Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the alternate identifier. Analogous to "Text" in component 2. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component. Analogous to Name of Coding System above. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Coding System Version Id
fields.description: This component carries the version for the coding system identified by components 1-3. If CWE.3 is populated with a value other than HL7nnnn or is of table type user-defined, version ID must be valued with an actual version ID. If CWE.3 is populated with a value of HL7nnnn and nnnn is of table type HL7, version ID may have an actual value or it may be absent. If version ID is absent, it will be interpreted to have the same value as the HL7 version number in the message header.

fields.name: Alternate Coding System Version Id
fields.description: This component carries the version for the coding system identified by components 4-6.

fields.name: Original Text
fields.description: The original text that was available to an automated process or a human before a specific code was assigned.

fields.name: Item Type
fields.description: The Item Type is a classification of material items into like groups as defined and utilized within an Operating Room setting for charting procedures. An Item Type is a higher level of classification than an Item Category as described in ITM-4.

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: The first component contains the sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the CWE.2. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: The second component contains the descriptive or textual name of the identifier, e.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression.

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: The third component contains the code for the name of the coding system from which the value in CWE.1 is obtained. Each coding system is assigned a unique identifier.

fields.name: Alternate Identifier
fields.description: An alternate sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. Analogous to "Identifier" in component 1. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Alternate Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the alternate identifier. Analogous to "Text" in component 2. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component. Analogous to Name of Coding System above. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Coding System Version Id
fields.description: This component carries the version for the coding system identified by components 1-3. If CWE.3 is populated with a value other than HL7nnnn or is of table type user-defined, version ID must be valued with an actual version ID. If CWE.3 is populated with a value of HL7nnnn and nnnn is of table type HL7, version ID may have an actual value or it may be absent. If version ID is absent, it will be interpreted to have the same value as the HL7 version number in the message header.

fields.name: Alternate Coding System Version Id
fields.description: This component carries the version for the coding system identified by components 4-6.

fields.name: Original Text
fields.description: The original text that was available to an automated process or a human before a specific code was assigned.

fields.name: Item Category
fields.description: The Item Category is a classification of material items into like groups for the purpose of categorizing purchases and reporting within a materials management setting. The Item Category classification is a lower level grouping of material items than what is described in ITM-3 as Item Type. UNSPSC is the recommended coding system.

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: The first component contains the sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the CWE.2. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: The second component contains the descriptive or textual name of the identifier, e.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression.

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: The third component contains the code for the name of the coding system from which the value in CWE.1 is obtained. Each coding system is assigned a unique identifier.

fields.name: Alternate Identifier
fields.description: An alternate sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. Analogous to "Identifier" in component 1. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Alternate Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the alternate identifier. Analogous to "Text" in component 2. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component. Analogous to Name of Coding System above. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Coding System Version Id
fields.description: This component carries the version for the coding system identified by components 1-3. If CWE.3 is populated with a value other than HL7nnnn or is of table type user-defined, version ID must be valued with an actual version ID. If CWE.3 is populated with a value of HL7nnnn and nnnn is of table type HL7, version ID may have an actual value or it may be absent. If version ID is absent, it will be interpreted to have the same value as the HL7 version number in the message header.

fields.name: Alternate Coding System Version Id
fields.description: This component carries the version for the coding system identified by components 4-6.

fields.name: Original Text
fields.description: The original text that was available to an automated process or a human before a specific code was assigned.

fields.name: Subject to Expiration Indicator
fields.description: This field contains an indicator used as a reference to specify whether the item is subject to containing an expiration date. Refer to HL7 Table 0532 - Expanded yes/no indicator table in Chapter 2 for valid values.

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: The first component contains the sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the CNE.2. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: The second component contains the descriptive or textual name of the identifier, e.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression. This is the corresponding text assigned by the coding system to the identifier.

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: The third component contains the code for the name of the coding system from which the value in CNE.1 is obtained.Refer to HL7 Table 0396 - Coding System s in section 2.16.4, "Coding System Table" for valid values. Each coding system is assigned a unique identifier.

fields.name: Alternate Identifier
fields.description: Analogous to “Identifier” in component 1.

fields.name: Alternate Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the alternate identifier. Analogous to "Text" in component 2.

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component. Analogous to Name of Coding System in component 3. Refer to HL7 Table 0396 - Coding Systems in section 2.16.4, "Coding System Table" for valid values.

fields.name: Coding System Version Id
fields.description: the version ID for the coding system identified by component 3. It belongs conceptually to components 1-3 and appears here only for reasons of backward compatibility.

fields.name: Alternate Coding System Version Id
fields.description: the version ID for the coding system identified by component 6. It belongs conceptually to the group of Alternate components (see note 2.A.1) and appears here only for reasons of backward compatibility.

fields.name: Original Text
fields.description: The original text that was available to an automated process or a human before a specific code was assigned.

fields.name: Manufacturer Identifier
fields.description: This field identifies the identifying code of the manufacturer of the item.

fields.name: Entity Identifier
fields.description: The first component, <entity identifier>, is usually defined to be unique within the series of identifiers created by the <assigning authority>, defined by a hierarchic designator, represented by components 2 through 4. See Section 2.A.33, "HD - hierarchic designator".

fields.name: Namespace Id
fields.description: The assigning authority is a unique identifier of the system (or organization or agency or department) that creates the data. Refer to User-defined Table 0363 - Assigning authority for suggested values.

fields.name: Manufacturer Name
fields.description: This field identifies the name of the manufacturer of the manufacturer identified in ITM-7.

fields.name: Manufacturer Catalog Number
fields.description: This field contains the catalog assigned to the item by the manufacturer.

fields.name: Manufacturer Labeler Identification Code
fields.description: This field contains the Labeler Identification Code (LIC) number assigned to the manufacturer that represents the manufacturer of the item.

fields.name: Text

fields.name: Original Text
fields.description: The original text that was available to an automated process or a human before a specific code was assigned.

fields.name: Patient Chargeable Indicator
fields.description: This field indicates whether the item is patient chargeable.  Refer to HL7 Table 0532 – Expanded Yes/no Indicator table in Chapter 2 for valid values.

fields.name: Alternate Coding System Version Id
fields.description: the version ID for the coding system identified by component 6. It belongs conceptually to the group of Alternate components (see note 2.A.1) and appears here only for reasons of backward compatibility.

fields.name: Original Text
fields.description: The original text that was available to an automated process or a human before a specific code was assigned.

fields.name: Transaction Code
fields.description:
This field contains the code assigned by the institution for the purpose of uniquely identifying a patient billing code specific for a supply item.  In the context of this message, this is a code that is a cross-reference to the Item Code/Id.  This field would be used to uniquely identify a procedure, supply item, or test for charges; or to identify the payment medium for payments. It can reference, for example, a CBC (a lab charge), or an Elastic Bandage 3'' (supply charge), or Chest 1 View (radiology charge).   For instance the code would be 300-0001, with a description of CBC.

Refer to User-defined Table 0132 - Transaction Code for suggested values.  See Chapter 7 for a discussion of the universal service ID for charges.

fields.description: The first component contains the sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the CWE.2. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: The second component contains the descriptive or textual name of the identifier, e.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression.

fields.name: Name Of Coding System

fields.name: Original Text
fields.description: The original text that was available to an automated process or a human before a specific code was assigned.

fields.name: Transaction amount - unit
fields.description: Unit price of transaction. Price of a single item. This field contains the dollar amount charged to patients for this item.

fields.name: Price
fields.description: The only required component; usually containing a decimal point. Note that each component of the MO data type (Section 2.A.41, "MO - money") is a subcomponent here.

fields.name: Quantity
fields.description: The first component is a quantity.

fields.name: Denomination
fields.description: The second component is the denomination in which the quantity is expressed. The values for the denomination component are those specified in ISO-4217. If the denomination is not specified, "MSH-17-country code", in section 2.14.9.17, is used to determine the default.

fields.name: Price Type
fields.description: A coded value, data type ID. Refer to HL7 Table 0205 - Price type for valid values.

fields.name: From Value
fields.description: Each is a NM data type; together they specify the "range". The range can be defined as either time or quantity. For example, the range can indicate that the first 10 minutes of the procedure has one price. Another repetition of the data type can use the range to specify that the following 10 to 60 minutes of the procedure is charged at another price per; a final repetition can specify that the final 60 to N minutes of the procedure at a third price.

fields.name: To Value
fields.description: See <from value>.

fields.name: Range Units
fields.description: A coded value, data type CWE, defined by the standard table of units for either time or quantity (see for example, the tables in Section 7.1.4, "Coding schemes"). This describes the units associated with the range, e.g., seconds, minutes, hours, days, quantity (i.e., count); it is required if <from value> and <to value> are present.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: The second component contains the descriptive or textual name of the identifier, e.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression.

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: The third component contains the code for the name of the coding system from which the value in CWE.1 is obtained. Each coding system is assigned a unique identifier.

fields.name: Original Text
fields.description: The original text that was available to an automated process or a human before a specific code was assigned.

fields.name: Stocked Item Indicator
fields.description: This field contains an indicator signifying whether the item is stocked in any inventory location in the healthcare organization. Refer to HL7 Table 0532 – Expanded Yes/no Indicator table in Chapter 2 for valid values.

fields.name: Text

fields.name: Original Text
fields.description: The original text that was available to an automated process or a human before a specific code was assigned.

fields.name: Supply Risk Codes
fields.description: This field contains a code that identifies any known or suspected hazard associated with this material item.

fields.name: Original Text
fields.description: The original text that was available to an automated process or a human before a specific code was assigned.

fields.name: Approving Regulatory Agency
fields.dataTypeName: Extended Composite Name and Identification Number for Organizations
fields.description:
This field contains a code indicating the regulatory agency the item has been approved by, such as the FDA or AMA.

Refer to User-defined Table 0790 – Approving Regulatory Agency for suggested values.

fields.name: Organization Name
fields.description: The name of the specified organization.

fields.name: Organization Name Type Code
fields.description: A code that represents the type of name i.e., legal name, display name. Refer to User-defined Table 0204 - Organizational Name Type for suggested values.

fields.name: Id Number
fields.description: This component has been retained for backward compatibility only as of v 2.5. It is recommended to use component 10 Organization identifier that accommodates alphanumeric identifiers.

fields.name: Identifier Check Digit
fields.description: This component contains the digit, or digits, exclusive of the identifier in XON.1, usually calculated by applying an algorithm to all or some of the digits in the number, which may be used to test validity of the non-check-digit identifier.

fields.name: Check Digit Scheme
fields.description: Contains the code identifying the check digit scheme employed.

fields.name: Assigning Authority
fields.description: The assigning authority is a unique identifier of the system (or organization or agency or department) that creates the data. Assigning authorities are unique across a given HL7 implementation. Refer to User-defined Table 0363 - Assigning Authority for suggested values.

fields.name: Namespace Id
fields.description: Namespace ID is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component.

fields.name: Universal Id
fields.description: The HDs second component, <universal ID> (UID), is a string formatted according to the scheme defined by the third component, <universal ID type> (UID type). The UID is intended to be unique over time within the UID type. It is rigorously defined. Each UID must belong to one of the specifically enumerated schemes for constructing UIDs (defined by the UID type). The UID (second component) must follow the syntactic rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component). Note that these syntactic rules are not defined within HL7 but are defined by the rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component).

fields.name: Universal Id Type
fields.description: The third component governs the interpretation of the second component of the HD. If the third component is a known UID refer to HL7 Table 0301 - Universal ID type for valid values, then the second component is a universal ID of that type.

fields.name: Identifier Type Code
fields.description: A code corresponding to the type of identifier. In some cases, this code may be used as a qualifier to the "Assigning authority" component. Refer to HL7 Table 0203 - Identifier type for suggested values.

fields.name: Assigning Facility
fields.description: The place or location identifier where the identifier was first assigned to the person. This component is not an inherent part of the identifier but rather part of the history of the identifier: as part of this data type, its existence is a convenience for certain intercommunicating systems.

fields.name: Namespace Id
fields.description: Namespace ID is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component.

fields.name: Universal Id
fields.description: The HDs second component, <universal ID> (UID), is a string formatted according to the scheme defined by the third component, <universal ID type> (UID type). The UID is intended to be unique over time within the UID type. It is rigorously defined. Each UID must belong to one of the specifically enumerated schemes for constructing UIDs (defined by the UID type). The UID (second component) must follow the syntactic rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component). Note that these syntactic rules are not defined within HL7 but are defined by the rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component).

fields.name: Universal Id Type
fields.description: The third component governs the interpretation of the second component of the HD. If the third component is a known UID refer to HL7 Table 0301 - Universal ID type for valid values, then the second component is a universal ID of that type.

fields.name: Name Representation Code
fields.description: Different <name/address types> and representations of the same <name/address> should be described by repeating of this field, with different values of the <name/address type> and/or <name/address representation> component.

fields.name: Organization Identifier
fields.description: This component contains the sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by XON.1 Organization Name. This component replaces XON.3 ID Number as of v 2.5.

fields.name: Latex Indicator
fields.description: This field contains an indicator signifying whether the item is made of or contains latex.  Refer to HL7 Table 0532 - Expanded yes/no indicator table in Chapter 2 for valid values.

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: The first component contains the sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the CNE.2. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text

fields.description: Analogous to “Identifier” in component 1.

fields.name: Alternate Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the alternate identifier. Analogous to "Text" in component 2.

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component. Analogous to Name of Coding System in component 3. Refer to HL7 Table 0396 - Coding Systems in section 2.16.4, "Coding System Table" for valid values.

fields.name: Coding System Version Id
fields.description: the version ID for the coding system identified by component 3. It belongs conceptually to components 1-3 and appears here only for reasons of backward compatibility.

fields.name: Alternate Coding System Version Id
fields.description: the version ID for the coding system identified by component 6. It belongs conceptually to the group of Alternate components (see note 2.A.1) and appears here only for reasons of backward compatibility.

fields.name: Original Text
fields.description: The original text that was available to an automated process or a human before a specific code was assigned.

fields.name: Ruling Act
fields.description: This field contains a code indicating an act containing a rule that the item is legally required to be included in notification reporting.  This code is often used for reporting or tracking.

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: The first component contains the sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the CWE.2. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: The second component contains the descriptive or textual name of the identifier, e.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression.

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: The third component contains the code for the name of the coding system from which the value in CWE.1 is obtained. Each coding system is assigned a unique identifier.

fields.name: Alternate Identifier
fields.description: An alternate sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. Analogous to "Identifier" in component 1. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Alternate Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the alternate identifier. Analogous to "Text" in component 2. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component. Analogous to Name of Coding System above. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Coding System Version Id
fields.description: This component carries the version for the coding system identified by components 1-3. If CWE.3 is populated with a value other than HL7nnnn or is of table type user-defined, version ID must be valued with an actual version ID. If CWE.3 is populated with a value of HL7nnnn and nnnn is of table type HL7, version ID may have an actual value or it may be absent. If version ID is absent, it will be interpreted to have the same value as the HL7 version number in the message header.

fields.name: Alternate Coding System Version Id
fields.description: This component carries the version for the coding system identified by components 4-6.

fields.name: Original Text
fields.description: The original text that was available to an automated process or a human before a specific code was assigned.

fields.name: Item Natural Account Code
fields.description: This field contains the expense/natural account number from the general ledger chart of accounts associated with the item. Refer to HL7 Table 0320 – Item Natural Account Code in Chapter 4 for valid values.

fields.name: Approved To Buy Quantity
fields.description: This field contains the quantity of this item that can be purchased within a user-defined time frame (e.g., one year) at the order unit of measure

fields.name: Approved To Buy Price
fields.description: This field contains the dollar limit of this item that you can purchase within a user-defined time frame (e.g., one year).

fields.name: Quantity
fields.description: The first component is a quantity.

fields.name: Denomination
fields.description: The second component is the denomination in which the quantity is expressed. The values for the denomination component are those specified in ISO-4217. If the denomination is not specified, "MSH-17-country code", in section 2.14.9.17, is used to determine the default.

fields.name: Taxable Item Indicator
fields.description: This field contains an indicator signifying whether the item is taxable when purchasing the item or issuing the item to patients.  Refer to HL7 Table 0532 - Expanded yes/no indicator table in Chapter 2 for valid values.

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: The first component contains the sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the CNE.2. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: The second component contains the descriptive or textual name of the identifier, e.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression. This is the corresponding text assigned by the coding system to the identifier.

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: The third component contains the code for the name of the coding system from which the value in CNE.1 is obtained.Refer to HL7 Table 0396 - Coding System s in section 2.16.4, "Coding System Table" for valid values. Each coding system is assigned a unique identifier.

fields.name: Alternate Identifier
fields.description: Analogous to “Identifier” in component 1.

fields.name: Alternate Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the alternate identifier. Analogous to "Text" in component 2.

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component. Analogous to Name of Coding System in component 3. Refer to HL7 Table 0396 - Coding Systems in section 2.16.4, "Coding System Table" for valid values.

fields.name: Coding System Version Id
fields.description: the version ID for the coding system identified by component 3. It belongs conceptually to components 1-3 and appears here only for reasons of backward compatibility.

fields.name: Alternate Coding System Version Id
fields.description: the version ID for the coding system identified by component 6. It belongs conceptually to the group of Alternate components (see note 2.A.1) and appears here only for reasons of backward compatibility.

fields.name: Original Text
fields.description: The original text that was available to an automated process or a human before a specific code was assigned.

fields.name: Freight Charge Indicator
fields.description: This field contains an indicator signifying whether freight is an allowable charge to be allocated to the line of an invoice containing the item.  Refer to HL7 Table 0532 - Expanded yes/no indicator table in Chapter 2 for valid values.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: The second component contains the descriptive or textual name of the identifier, e.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression. This is the corresponding text assigned by the coding system to the identifier.

fields.description: Analogous to “Identifier” in component 1.

fields.name: Alternate Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the alternate identifier. Analogous to "Text" in component 2.

fields.description: the version ID for the coding system identified by component 3. It belongs conceptually to components 1-3 and appears here only for reasons of backward compatibility.

fields.name: Alternate Coding System Version Id
fields.description: the version ID for the coding system identified by component 6. It belongs conceptually to the group of Alternate components (see note 2.A.1) and appears here only for reasons of backward compatibility.

fields.name: Original Text
fields.description: The original text that was available to an automated process or a human before a specific code was assigned.

fields.name: Item Set Indicator
fields.description: This field contains an indicator signifying whether the item is an 'item set' rather than an individual item.  An item set is a set of surgical supplies.  Refer to HL7 Table 0532 - Expanded yes/no indicator table in Chapter 2 for valid values.

fields.name: Original Text
fields.description: The original text that was available to an automated process or a human before a specific code was assigned.

fields.name: Item Set Identifier
fields.description: The Item Identifier is a unique code assigned to the material item by the Item Inventory Master catalog software application to identify the item.

fields.name: Entity Identifier
fields.description: The first component, <entity identifier>, is usually defined to be unique within the series of identifiers created by the <assigning authority>, defined by a hierarchic designator, represented by components 2 through 4. See Section 2.A.33, "HD - hierarchic designator".

fields.name: Namespace Id
fields.description: The assigning authority is a unique identifier of the system (or organization or agency or department) that creates the data. Refer to User-defined Table 0363 - Assigning authority for suggested values.

fields.name: Track Department Usage Indicator
fields.description: This field contains an indicator signifying whether the usage figures are tracked for this item by department.  Refer to HL7 Table 0532 - Expanded yes/no indicator table in Chapter 2 for valid values.

fields.name: Procedure Code
fields.description: This field contains a unique identifier assigned to the service item, if any, associated with the charge.  In the United States this is often the HCPCS code.  Refer to Externally defined Table 0088 - Procedure code for suggested values.  This field is a CNE data type for compatibility with clinical and ancillary systems.

fields.name: Procedure Code Modifier
fields.description:
This field contains the procedure code modifier to the procedure code reported in ITM-27 – Procedure Cod, when applicable.  Procedure code modifiers are defined by USA regulatory agencies such as CMS and the AMA.  Multiple modifiers may be reported.  Refer to Externally defined Table 0340 - Procedure code modifier for suggested values.  

As of v2.6, the known applicable external coding systems include those in the table below. If the code set you are using is in this table, then you must use that designation.
